Package com.independentid.scim.schema

Class SchemaManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.independentid.scim.schema.SchemaManager
  • @Singleton
@Default
@Named("SchemaMgr")
public class SchemaManager
extends java.lang.Object
    SchemaManager loads schema from configuration files or the back end when available. It us users by ScimResource and other classes to provide resource and attribute type definitions. Previously this was contained within ConfigMgr and is migrated to solve bootstrap issues.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SchemaManager

        public SchemaManager​(java.io.InputStream schemaStream,
                     java.io.InputStream typeStream)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     ScimException
        This constructor used for command line instantiation or versions without server.
        Parameters:
        schemaStream - An InputStream containing the JSON formatted SCIM schema file. May be a ListResponse stream (e.g. loaded from a /Schemas endpoint)
        typeStream - An InputStream containing the JSON formatted Resource type config file. May be a ListResponse stream (e.g. loaded from a /ResourceTypes endpoint)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when JSON config file cannot be loaded
        ScimException - Thrown due to a JSON parsing error

      • SchemaManager

        public SchemaManager​(java.lang.String schemaPath,
                     java.lang.String typesPath)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     ScimException
        This constructor used for command line instantiation or versions without server.
        Parameters:
        schemaPath - The file path to the JSON formatted SCIM schema file
        typesPath - File path to the JSON formatted Resource type config file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when JSON config file cannot be loaded
        ScimException - Thrown due to a JSON parsing error

    • Method Detail

      • init

        @PostConstruct
public void init()
          throws ScimException,
                 java.io.IOException,
                 BackendException
        During initial startup, the default Schema and ResourceTypes are loaded into the server. Once the rest of the server is started, ConfigMgr may check the backend provider to see if there is persisted schema available.
        Throws:
        ScimException - due to invalid data in schema config
        java.io.IOException - due to problems accessing files
        BackendException - when configured to load schema from provider and provider error occurs

        public void loadDefaultSchema()
                       throws ScimException,
                              java.io.IOException
        Loads the default schema from the config properties into ConfigMgr "schIdMap" map.
        Throws:
        ScimException - thrown configured filepath is undefined or invalid, or due to invalid JSON
        java.io.IOException - thrown due to file processing errors (missing file)

                            com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator gen)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Serializes a result using the provided JsonGenerator. Does not close or flush the generator.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The SCIM RequestCtx - which specifies all the request parameters
        gen - The JsonGenerator with which to generate the result.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown due to error serializing schema identified in RequestCtx

      • serializeSchema

        public java.lang.String serializeSchema​(RequestCtx ctx,
                                        java.io.Writer writer)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method used in support of queries to the /Schemas endpoint passed via ConfigResponse.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The SCIM RequestCtx - which specifies all the request parameters
        writer - If provided, output will be sent to the writer specified. Otherwise a String is returned.
        Returns:
        A string containing the schema corresponding to the Path requested in RequestCtx.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when error occurs serializing Schema identified in RequestCtx, or a writer error.

        Throws:

      • serializeResourceTypes

        public java.lang.String serializeResourceTypes​(RequestCtx ctx,
                                               java.io.Writer writer)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        ctx - The SCIM RequestCtx - which specifies all the request parameters
        writer - If provided, output will be sent to the writer specified. Otherwise a String is returned.
        Returns:
        A String containing the serialized JSON value. Returns null if a writer is specified.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when attempting to write serialized ResourceType to a writer

      • findAttribute

        public Attribute findAttribute​(java.lang.String schemaId,
                               java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String subAttrName,
                               RequestCtx ctx)
        Thie method looks up an Attribute type based on one of 3 methods: 1. If schemaId is provided, the attribute is matched from there. 2. If no attribute found, the RequestCtx is checked for a ResourceType where the container schema and extensions are used 3. If still no match, all schemas are checked for a match. Note: this method cannot be used to locate sub=attributes directly.
        Parameters:
        schemaId - Optional Schema URN or null
        name - The base attribute name (required)
        subAttrName - The name of a sub-attribute if desired or null
        ctx - Optional RequestCtx object (used to detect resourceType)
        Returns:
        The matching Attribute or null if not matched

      • findAttribute

        public Attribute findAttribute​(java.lang.String path,
                               RequestCtx ctx)
        This method takes a full attribute path and parses it to find the Attribute type associated. If it is a sub-attribute, the schema is walked until the sub-attribute is located
        Parameters:
        path - The path (incl URN) or base path (e.g. attr.subattr) for the attribute
        ctx - The request context (used to detect resource type to default schema urn)
        Returns:
        The Attribute type for the attribute path requested.

      • getResourceTypeByPath

        public ResourceType getResourceTypeByPath​(java.lang.String path)
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the endpoint without leading "/" (case-insensitive)
        Returns:
        The ResourceType that defines the endpoint

      • getResourceTypeByName

        public ResourceType getResourceTypeByName​(java.lang.String name)
        This is typically used to convert the String value form Meta.getResourceType() back into an actual ResourceType
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the resource type to return;
        Returns:
        a ResourceType object with the name specified.

        public Schema getSchemaById​(java.lang.String id)
        Parameters:
        id - May be the schema id value or the schema name to locate the corresponding Schema object
        Returns:
        The Schema object that corresponds to the schema urn provided

      • getSchemas

        public java.util.Collection<Schema> getSchemas()
        Returns:
        The Collection of all Schema objects from the Schema Id hash map.

      • persistSchemaMode

        public boolean persistSchemaMode()

      • checkAndLoadStoredSchema

        public boolean checkAndLoadStoredSchema()
                                 throws ScimException
        This method checks the persistence provider to see if the data for Schema and ResourceTypes has already been stored. In this case of a new database, the data has to first be loaded from json config files via loadDefaultSchema/loadDefaultResoruceTypes.
        Returns:
        true if schema exists and was loaded
        Throws:
        SchemaException - when backend is unable to parse the stored schema.
        ScimException

        public void persistSchema()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public java.lang.String generateTransactionId()
        Obtains an identifier that acceptable to the backend provider.
        Returns:
        A unique identifier String for a transaction or resource identifier
